Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lcsGf8NTN1Sl1T8zjotSkQ.text: The food is amazing, the owner is so proud and attentive. Everything is fresh and you can tell with each bite! Have been for both breakfast and lunch, the French toast for breakfast and hummus for lunch are the best I have had!

j6-DwRvXyLcfTmMFiNQimw.text: This place has so much potential but the food is pretty bad. Ordered the Americano sandwich that comes with bacon and sausage. The way it is described in the menu it sounded like it was on the sandwich. Nope. No biggie though. I am pretty certain the sausage and bacon they serve is the fake kind. Bland sandwich but over seasoned potatoes and the restaurant bland awful water downed coffee to boot.

66t7vT7-cXmjEQhqqPEmYg.text: Staff is very friendly.  Their food items are very tasty while their pastries are not too sweet.  Their salad dressing is light, but just enough.

npX6YkmMKiBfgCHAe9lnjw.text: Passed this place several times and finally tried it today with my family. It's delicious! Fresh ingredients and great flavor! I had the French toast and it was better than expected!

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States

a5bGLJB30QFr_cIP3Lpsww.text: Great family run restaurant and bakery - super friendly!  I ordered a birthday cake from them and they did an excellent job!  I also ordered some pita and hummus and it was hands down some of the best hummus I've had.  I can't wait to go back and bring the family for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Adorable cake they made for my son&#39;s birthday!!!

bvycnjVXo7YLUyZAl8lYnw.text: My husband and I took guests for lunch at the Early Baker. The food is fresh and delicious. I had a crepe and my husband and friends had paninis. We all enjoyed our meals. We liked it so much that we returned another day during our friend's' visit. We sat outside on the patio so we could enjoy the beautiful weather. I like having a breakfast menu all day. The pastries in the case look good, too.

a4PSLRSjWuiZHZq-WHkZNg.text: My first time here and I'm overwhelmed!!! The food is great and the bakery is to die for!! The owners are kind and generous and were nice enough to sample an organic piece of homemade apple pie with fresh whipped cream and Carmel!! WOW! Amazing organic pie!! You have to come and try this place!!! You won't be sorry:)))) trust me!! I'll be back for sure!! Xo Ginger

avfCrQQ_-TzMuyXuo5d6HQ.text: The girls and I were finishing dinner at Pomegranate Cafe and wanted dessert... saw this place in the parking lot and I guess they've only been open 2 weeks. Walked in about 15 min before they closed and were given the royal treatment!! Everything looked so amazing and we couldn't decide so the owners offered to give us a sampling of several of their desserts! They were all amazing! My favorites were the chocolate croissants and lemon bars!! They've got so many influences from around the world in their baking and we really just enjoyed getting to know the owners and hearing their stories. They set us up in their high tea room and just gave the best service!! Will definitely be coming back again and again!

d6V4qkC7_9alxKp8Bllz6g.text: This place is awesome. Great ppl and great food. Loved the owner/manager. Super nice guy.

4PvSx7H28Xz215OKln6iGg.text: Came here with a party of 15 after a wedding and we were immediately seated at a table big enough for all of us and within 15 minutes we had food on the table. Service was incredible and the food was top notch. Would deffinetly recomend the Turkey Basil Melt, the Chicken Parm, and the Breakfast Special.

vP7pYhjUFJghrmSy0Rd0hA.text: Great little breakfast spot. I love their fresh made croissants. Family run and friendly environment. Stop by and try some of the fresh baked goodies.

qWqZWuHOGo6xuHF11dF_OQ.text: DELICIOUS!!!!!!  Perfectly cooked eggs on the most amazing croissant I have ever had and I've traveled Europe where the croissant was was born!  Seriously...I can't wait to eat the decadent pastries, muffins, cupcakes and other dishes they have on the menu!!  The owners and staff could not be any more gracious!!! This restaurant is a wonderful addition to our neighborhood! Clean, nice seating great location and did I say...delicious!!  I can't wait till tomorrow to try something else :-)

qGi3Nz_42R_oVQnxNugd-A.text: Great breakfast place! Great service, food, and nice patio. Try it! You won't be sorry!

457HS5Jzkr-puvY5aN31SQ.text: The croissants are amazing. Like real French croissants. Soft and flakey with perfect buttery layers. The danishes are delicious with homemade jam (the cherry is the best). The cheese horns are good as well.  I haven't tried ordering off the menu because the pastries are so good. It's nice to have a proper bakery with yummy pastries and good coffee.

SFZi9Dka2cWpAsjQRWi_bg.text: Healthy, delicious, well-prepared food created by folks who really know what they are doing. A very pleasant, comfortable atmosphere, on-site personable owners. The Early Baker is going to be a happy habit of mine, so glad I wandered in!

tIazVm7bpdUL5Lwk_YgeBg.text: I have eaten here twice and had them cater my daughters baby shower. The service and food all 3 times was excellent!  The owner, Adam, took time to help me choose the perfect food for the shower and I received so many compliments at the event.  While dining in their beautiful restaurant, I enjoyed the Greek salad and hummus!  I shared a lemon bar with my sister for desert, yummy!  My other sister, who is vegan, asked many questions that were answered patiently and she was delighted with their Tomato Basil soup!  Each visit has been wonderful!  Thank you Early Baker!

GIEEATpsVSkHBEqzlcm5pw.text: Early Baker is a hidden gem in Ahwatukee.  Tucked into the Safeway plaza on Chandler Blvd, its family oriented relaxed atmosphere makes it the perfect locale for a cup of coffee with a friend or a family breakfast/lunch.  The owners are warm and friendly-- always happy to see you.  They greet you with a smile and invite you to linger over delectable pastries and delicious coffee.  I have never had a more marvelous macaroon than from Early Baker!

P07WP9QcX-nnWXXHbTuqfA.text: I stumbled across this place after shopping at Trader Joe's.  I took home a turkey panini, a piece of cheese cake and 2 spinach puff pastries.  Loved every bite!  The panini was enough for 2 people.  It came with a delicious salad and was very good.  The puff pastries were nice and so was the cheese cake.  I want to go there for breakfast.  Great place!

vmLOHcpL9HoSHM7EDVhPuQ.text: Had breakfast here. Food and service was less than mediocre. My husband, mother and I all ordered breakfast sandwiches. They ordered the same sandwich and I got a different one. Somehow all of our sandwiches were exactly the same with the exception of a puny piece of sausage and bacon on the side with mine. Which was actually supposed to be on the sandwich. Each sandwich was accompanied by about 5 potatoes and the most bland Greek salad I've ever had. Everything tasted like it was pulled straight from the frozen section of frys and microwaved. Yet it took almost 25 minutes to get our food; no silverware, no condiments, no salt and pepper. Coffee was served luke warm and I had to get up and bring my cup across the room to where the cream and sugar were. Just a very weird, Uninviting setup. Nobody asked how we were, how the food was, or if we needed anything. Will not be returning.

W1CkyKj_DYRXuxibSWBILA.text: My first visit and it was excellent! Had the Turkey Panini because the suoer-pleasent girl behind the counter recommended it.  Was served quickly and the panini was wonderful.  Nice fresh Greek salad on the side too.  Definately will be back.

xo5gd9hadnE4erlLCOzaxw.text: Everything I eat here is as good or better than I have eaten anywhere else  Croissants are the best I've ever had.  Ditto crepes.  Just eaten Chicken Marsala for dinner and I can't remember having better.  There's an obvious love and passion for the food that shows up in everything they produce and they absolutely have the skill to back it up.  You'll never go wrong with anything you order.  Tough for me to go anywhere else now.

Jl24b02KH2AfSaLNvZEb1A.text: Was very excited to have a new place open so close to home. Went for breakfast and was very disappointed. Breakfast sandwich was 2 pieces of regular bread, egg, bacon & cheese smashed in.Panini maker so it was very flat and not to tasty. Potatos were bland and dry. The sandwich with only water to drink was $13 with tax. Hardly any baked goods in case and it was 10 am in.the morning. Was disappointed to say the least. No friendly service when placing the order and server kept trying to give us some one else's order. To many other good places to go to so probably won't go back.

-tk7LWpdsn3QS9Vmtk1fvA.text: Hands down some of the best service you will get in Ahwatukee or Phoenix as a whole, and delicious food! I heard about this restaurant through local neighborhood facebook groups, so we have dropped in a few times for a casual meal. It is a family-owned business that reminds me of the place I worked in Tampa, FL for over three years. Great service, warm and friendly atmosphere, and really good food with a mediterranean twist. I love the breakfast options - they are filling but not heavy, especially the Early Greek, Early American, and Egg Boat. The coffee is good too.   If you're looking for somewhere to bring the family or even a date, this is your spot!

tFk9rLIcWfO8bMjuYQV7hA.text: This is one of the best places I've been to have breakfast. It's my first time here and the Early American egg sandwich that I ordered was very good. My brother and I enjoyed it! Decoration is very cute and employees here are super nice and friendly. I would definitely come back here again!

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Early American egg sandwich
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Early American egg sandwich

07q4Qlv1LvsL8vmYIfrpjw.text: Came by yesterday to get a slice of the tres leches  cake!  Stepped into one of the most charming spots! My mom and I met Adam, one of the owners, such a gracious host. The cake is AMAZING and the croissant is  for sure the BEST I have had (his wife makes it all)!  I can not wait to try some of the other dishes they make there.  I definitely recommend Early Baker it is a great place to connect and enjoy.

tZjuDep5nOKbv0FMTin5pQ.text: Was searching Yelp for something to eat and wow were we glad we saw this place.  The food was delicious (breakfast served all day - had the veggie frittata) and the service devine.  The owner, Adam, brought us extras... homemade cheese pita to try.  We gobbled that up.  Our meals were tasty and we had eyed the homemade desserts.  On Adam's suggestion we decided to share the German chocolate cake.  He brought us a HUGE "sharing piece" and fed us each a bite while cracking jokes and entertaining our marriage proposals   But seriously the best host and the most delicious food and Turkish coffee too!  A must stop!  We will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. German chocolate cake for 3... couldn&#39;t finish this huge piece!! Yum!

axOGfhlgZfsExLURxN4b9Q.text: My friend told me she had breakfast here and liked it. I had my eye on it every time I ran into Pomegranate Cafe, but hadn't tried it yet.  That was it- I had to give it a shot.  Heads up: It's in the same parking lot as Trader Joe's, and parking can get crazy at rush shopping hour.   I invited a foodie friend so we could experience the place together. I really liked the casual "hang-out" atmosphere the couches and mix and match tables/table heights gave the space.  More like walking into someones home and hanging out. Nice. Oh-they have a pretty nice outdoor area that is comfy looking too.  You walk up and order at the front, they give you a number to place on the table you pick-then they deliver your food. Don't forget to leave a tip in the tip jar!  We ordered the chicken sausage omelette. Was VERY delicious. The potatoes that came with were a bit boring, but the flavors of the omelette made up for it.   The portions were big and we were stuffed, and chatting away in bliss.   I came for dinner after this and ordered clam linguine and the flavor was off to me-tasted like a lot of dill pickle juice in the sauce? The portion was good, the clams fresh, but I could barely finish because of the sauce. Hmmm... Figured I'd give dinner ONE more try.  Glad I did. The Chicken Parmigiana was super delicious. I hit that plate running and hardly came up for air!  The side salad was very fresh and had great variety of greens. Dressing yummy too. Oh yeah-NOW we're hitting on all 8 cylinders.  Last meal I tried a Mexican breakfast burrito. It was sort of panini style-which sounds weird, but weirdly worked. Very good. Man-so big I could barely squeeze it all down-but I managed. I have pic's of it...  The owners have put a lot of thought into the decor and comfort-it shows.  I will be back often, and happily introduce friends to it.

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The salad from my Chicken parmigiana meal-trying to find the pic of meal itself!
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Same-close up
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. great Mexican breakfast Burrito

U8TqGYOoC7GL8rErCRnCwQ.text: I love this place!! The food is great and the customer service is warm, thorough and friendly! Adam the owner, exceptional!!! They even have a space to host a small event or gathering. Awesome!!

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1COwgxdBRQeK0VjL-DCMag.text: I've been hearing all about the Early Baker through ahwatukee 411. My mom and I finally came to try it and had an amazing experience!!! We started off with the grape leaves. It comes half with meat and half vegan grape leaves. I couldn't tell which one I liked better because they were both delicious! For my meal I ordered the salmon entree. First to come out was a starter Greek salad, it was light and delicious! My entree arrived and was plated beautiful! I'm telling you this was the best salmon I have ever had. It was so FRESH!!!! It was juicy and seasoned to perfection. The salmon laid on top of Spanish rice and roasted vegetables. It also came with bread. All this for $15???? This is what I would expect from a restaurant on the beech being sold for $50. Seriously amazing. The owner was awesome and treated us to a slice of lemon meringue pie. It was literally to die for. It was literally gone in seconds and my mom and I fought over the last bite. I really can't wait to come back and try more things from their menu! They have beautiful looking pastries and cakes on display. Overall the restaurant was very clean and so cute! I'm really glad to have found this ahwatukee gem.

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_syVzqCmjz45ejCqVLyxaA.text: I have rarely felt inclined to give a one star review but I couldn't believe the service I received at such a highly recommended local business. My sister in-law was in town and wanted a danish from a bakery one morning for breakfast. I had read good things about EarlyBaker so I wanted to give them a try.   I called ahead to see if they still had danishes since it was a little bit later in the morning and I know bakeries can sell out. They said they had plenty of danishes left, cheese and strawberry danishes. I had initially asked for a cheese danish, the man on the phone said "yes we have cheese" and then he said "we have some cheese and some strawberry" great! We headed over about 10 minutes after our phone call and the interaction we had was so uncomfortable.   A young girl who was working kept looking at us but never said a word. The man behind the counter was taking a very long time with the men ordering in front of us. We stood in front of the pastry case and looked at two sad looking dried out danishes, hoping those weren't the only ones. Finally the man came up to us and asked what we wanted. We said we called and asked about the danishes and would like 2 cheese danishes. He said "we are out". Ok? We called 10 minutes ago and were told there were plenty. He said he would go check in the back for more. He never came back to us but instead came out and started making coffee drinks and completely ignored us. Never said another word. It was so awkward and some of the worst customer service I have experienced. We walked out since neither of the employees cared to help us. (Mind you, the restaurant was dead on a Saturday morning, only two people there)  We came back the next day to give them another shot. The same man was there, not very friendly and the same dry looking pastries in the case. I was so over it at this point that I bought two of the "strawberry & cheese" danishes (turns out they don't have cheese AND strawberry, it's a combo). We got home to eat them and they were terrible. Dry as dry can be, very little filling and literally a tablespoon sized chunk of cold cream cheese. A horrible representation of what a danish is and what a bakery is. So dissatisfying and I will not return.

8TY4Hz332f2FIBwDWaRSzw.text: Stopped by one morning for breakfast. Ordered the french toast--the bread was very good, but the syrup served with the toast was odd. It definitely didn't taste like maple syrup. It had a sort of sour taste to it and I'm not sure I liked it.  I've also been by to try the German chocolate cake. That cake is very good. It isn't dry and has excellent flavor. All the ingredients in the cake seemed high quality.

-o8fysPwBzQ4GvMlv_Mtcg.text: This is a great place for breakfast. The menu isn't very extensive but they offer a nice mixture of meat and vegetarian/vegan options. They also have a great coffee selection. I probably had one of the best chia (dirty) at the location. They also have Turkish coffee that I will return to try later. The vegan burrito that I had was delicious, and i would definitely have the potatoes inside again. The salsa is spicy so be warned. Happy eating.

u-Ps2E0uPj3dxnzcspiKpg.text: I started this review twice but I realized I was rambling on. No one reads long reviews. The food here is exceptional and the coffee is fantastic. It's a little hard to resist all of the bakery items but thankfully they have a large selection of healthy options as well.   This restaurant could easily be at home in the Biltmore/Arcadia area but I'm glad it's here!

LbGBFf2Vs19uOCEl_p83rg.text: EarlyBaker. Such a great place for conversation over breakfast, lunch or dinner - even cake! We had a meet up last Friday and I just wanted to share our visit. Details. I am all about details. The setting was really nice and comfortable with a good, music vibe. The lighting was perfect. Very clean and welcoming. Yummy pastries ready on the counter glass-case. We had fresh hummus with a strip of olive oil and homemade, soft pitas with cucumber and tomato slices. Very delicious and plentiful. I had their strawberry mousse cake with an ice tea. It was really good!! Heavenly.  A huge cake slice, enough for two that I had to share with Kim. Our visit turned out to be 3 hours long.  Time flew but we did not notice. That just shows how nice it was.   Students, if you are looking for an alternative place to study or hangout with your friends- Early Baker is great. Thank you Adam Halik for taking care of us. It was really nice. Glad you are here.   -Melissa Lemme, Kim Kendall and myself. #Ahwatukee411

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TsgqmFQSTT0BikQokQKMmw.text: Stopped in and had dinner after reading really positive reviews on yelp thanks to all that left really good reviews Adam (owner) is friendly and recommended lamb chops So delicious and this was my first time trying lamb.  It was a very filling and tasty meal for 15$ not bad for lamb! The hummus and pita was delicious also. The food appears to be made in house and is fresh and full of flavor. Took home a macaroon, cannoli and a Swiss Roll. Treats are spot on too We will definitely be back!  Thanks again Adam!

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wwjiuF8QYcxruQNKQrIRTQ.text: I want to give this place more stars but nothing was outstanding it was barely ordinary. I love to support small or local businesses but they need to earn it. The waitress didn't know if they served chai lattes, had to go ask. Didn't know what kind of pastries were available, had to go ask. Each time she was gone a long time. There was not comfortable seating or atmosphere. The drink and pastry were nothing better than I could have made at home. Maybe worse. It was 11am on Sunday morning so maybe they would be better in the morning.

oK0V9-CaNNsPMxCGvQGzxA.text: I happened to walk into this place for breakfast on a Sunday morning not knowing what to expect. I have to say that I am surprised that it wasn't much busier but I am also not complaining about that. The menu has several options. I think that it's awesome that they serve breakfast all day. We tried a few different egg sandwiches and a berry crepe. The owner also brought us a chocolate croissant on the house. Everything tasted delicious and was reasonably priced. The decorations were adorable and it had a very homey cafe vibe. I felt very comfortable the whole time and picture this being a spot where I can grab a coffee, snack, and do homework. Very nice people and vibe! I was very impressed and will be back. Thank you for the hospitality!

cmR5fg4ltWlO_2jKgEzPdQ.text: We are again their last night.  Service was excellent and so was the food.     If you're not sure what to get for dinner get the lamb chops and fettuccine Alfredo.  Holy wow Batman.  Good luck finding better!

yzp_AX-MasG1SpUuBsZuew.text: Service is prompt and sooo polite. Love it!! I ordered a grilled vegetable salad with Salmon and it is out of this world delicious. My hubby ordered breakfast burritos and I quickly snapped a picture because they were going quick. He gives it two thumbs up. I like the variety of menu items and they accommodate vegan/vegetarian and have gluten free pita bread and some desserts.  The owner gave us a complimentary tiramisu for our first time in. The BEST tiramisu I have tasted yet!! Will come back.  Nice music and very clean.

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RfvVgiwWtF0Dt6vrzcUMyg.text: It's like Gordon Ramsey works here! The food is soooo tasty & real!!  I hope they never give away there secret formula! Everything is immaculate, great atmosphere, attention to detail!!  Thank you for an amazing experience I'll be back!!  True love at first taste!

KRuZwWhiZ2F8VRGMbfntKA.text: I was incredibly disappointed with this location. I ordered steak and eggs and they completely forgot about my order for over an hour. Every other person that had made purchases had already been served food that had ordered way after I had. When I told them I wanted my money back they said they were making it right at that momet that's ridiculous and poor business. I will never return here again.

cJ_9eLKC9BhltAn8mzA-4A.text: While visiting from Southern California, my husband and I wanted a breakfast spot that had flavor and EarlyBaker hit the spot! The potatoes had a distinct flavor, they were not bland or just tasteless. I ordered the egg cheese melt and it was delicious. The price is definitely worth it! The coffee and croissants were amazing as well. Great customer service and relaxing environment.

fvBAAW1Ize2bWEc9Dl_rPg.text: Kiana made a baptism cake for our son's special day and it was absolutely amazing.  They were so easy to work with and we were so impressed.   She listened carefully and accommodated our food allergies. I highly recommend Early Baker for any special occasion cake.

oE7sfa02aIPBi1UmrSauZQ.text: Just come see for yourself. My first time at the Early Baker and what really impressed me right off the bat was the decor; homely with a touch of modern-industrial. The pastries were splendid, one of the best croissants I have ever had. The brioche french toast was to die for. Will be back tomorrow!

BlykxYHsUYmkqTZMwkzzzQ.text: My review is based on their breakfast menu, we did not try any of their pastries which had good reviews. Anytime a new place opens up in Ahwatukee, we are always excited to try it. A group of friends went there for breakfast and was under whelmed. First of all, don't call it steak and eggs when it's thinly sliced roast beef. That is very misleading. Also, when ordering a side of turkey sausage, keep in mind it is $3 for ONE 2" mini sausage sliced in half. I had the Early American which consisted of a toasted white plain bread sandwich with eggs, cheese and bacon. Not real bacon, but turkey bacon. I'm ok with turkey bacon, but real bacon is entirely different. It was served with 2 slices of cucumbers, 2 wedges of tomatoes and seasoned potatoes. The potatoes looked so good, but was so disappointed when we took a bite. It was not cooked enough. A friend had the French toast drizzled with strawberries which looked amazing and she enjoyed it.   The portions were really small as well and we spent about $40 for 2 breakfasts entrees and 2 drinks. That's a lot of money for mediocre breakfast to begin with and to have the portions small and not very good, is disappointing to say the least. Unfortunately, all of us don't think we will return. They are nice there, but we felt like we wasted our money. We would've been ok with smaller portions for the price if the food was better quality.  The other reviews on the pastries seem to be really good. If that's the case, focus on the bakery items and make that the star and incorporate that into your menu.

Xt7tEhfLV9hRj-bKoinsoQ.text: On the fence with this place. The decor is really cute, they did a great job with making it comfy and feeling like your at home. The service and food are really lacking. My hubby and I went for lunch and walked in with one other table of two ahead of us. There were only a few things on the menu that we'd consider trying so that's not a good start. There was a large group already seated in a side room and looked to be eating already and another couple that were finished so getting trendy to leave. That left 4 people only to have to cook for and I guess they felt the same as us regarding the menu cause they we ordered the same things except my hubby and me just ordered water with our meal. The lady at the counter who took our order got us the water right away but didn't bother to tell us that it was self service around the corner. Also what looked to be the owner was pacing around like he was either waiting for something or lost but didn't appear friendly at all. Not even a hey thanks for coming in to try the place. Anyway as far as the wait for the food wow!  Okay so your making 4 sandwiches, 2 of each kind and after abt 20 minutes of waiting the lady who took both our orders comes out to asks each of our tables to confirm our orders. That's 1 turkey panini and 1 chicken wrap per table. And then we waited another 20 minutes. Seriously people 40 minutes for sandwiches? I get made to order but really? So the paninis come out first. One for each table they looked nicely presented with a side salad then another few minutes she brings the chicken wrap with a side of what looked to be leftover breakfast potatoes. We split our food so that we each could taste it. I could tell immediately we were going to be really disappointed with our lunch. The panini literally had 2 very thinly sliced pieces of turkey and was served between whole wheat pots warmed but definitely not toasted on a panini press. The overall flavor was okay but nothing special. It needed more meat for a $11 sandwich. Yes, $12 for 2 slices of deli meat. Terrible. Then for the chicken wrap.  A huge tortilla with very little stuffing. We weren't surprised there. The chicken we abt 4oz and very little lettuce and a sprinkling of tomato.  But the garlic sauce they use as mayo was way over powering. Like kill a vampire too much. And it tasted to be garlic just mixed with Greek yogurt and a lot of garlic. It was not good and again another $12. This place is not gonna make it. The bakery didn't really offer a lot of what the demographics of the area will purchase. Some muffins and a couple variety of cookies won't cut it.  I couldn't tell if they are trying to be a bakery that sells some sandwiches and salads or a restaurant that sells bakery goods. Either way I don't see these owners making it but they did a great job of cleaning the place up from the pit that los dos left.

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oh here they are... they pressed the wrong sand which perhaps? Chicken wrap. With a whole lot of nothing in it.
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey panini. 2 slices of deli meat and definitely not pressed. Where are the grill marks?
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute decor/menu board and bakery case

09n6BHkqMO7eIWe6F8gq8g.text: Four stars only because the portions are rather small for the price you pay for them. The service was good, seems like a family operation so I can always respect that. Real nice location and a perfect spot to park yourself out in the patio and enjoy the beautiful weather rolling in. Steak and eggs were delish...

t9RbuTh0T5as9ieQDvxsAw.text: We dined at Early Baker on a quiet Monday evening and quite enjoyed our experience. I love the passion fruit iced tea!  That being said our dinners were excellent ...  we ordered the gyro and rice pilaf entrees which included a fresh side salad! Besides being tasty the food was nicely plated and the owner personally served us. Will be heading back soon to try their breakfast menu

5OR3DfAxZR0sKGsYAr8GhQ.text: Unfortunately for now my Vegan diet has ended due to personal reasons which i will not get into here. So my stomach was growling and i seen EarlyBaker ill keep it short and simple since im waiting on uber. Food taste amazing , very clean restaurant, make sure to check them out if your around Chandler Arizona.  I had the mushroom soup and bbq chicken panini with side salad. Tastes Amazing! 5 STARZ *****

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QF9Sd95pOSZp_TkHkgpqEQ.text: Good breakfast -- open early -- great service. There are lots of interesting choices on the menu. Definitely worth stepping by.

Mmgk6ntgq4EYUXQqD8fdtQ.text: Giving this place 3 stars until they figure out their service- everyone was pretty nice and accommodating but my coffee came out after 10 mins and was not even hot! Our food came out after waiting for 40 minutes! The egg and cheese melt was pretty legit- my 7 and 10 year old loved them! For a fast casual it was a bit pricey- our bill was 47 without tips for 3 dishes and a cafe mocha.  We spoke to what I assume was one of the owners and was told that the ingredients they used was only the best.  He also apologized and said they were in a soft launch- he should make that apparent so expectations would be lower.  I wish this place the best!

RMOyvTa9i6NT8YYkaX24VQ.text: The owners and staff were very warm and kind. The patio was dog friendly. Madison brought them water.

2sQ8h5zwiyf3ZxvmYRfL6g.text: Absolutely the BEST croissants in a 20 mile radius. Even better are the chocolate croissants! All the bakes goods are amazing and worth trying. The prices can be steep but you're paying for quality. I hope with time and better product sourcing the prices will become a bit more reasonable, because then I'd make the drive from Mesa weekly to indulge!

I1-UUVolscd8MloMr_vnlw.text: Food was very good. The salads and baked goods are my favorite.  Especially the croissants.  The restaurant is very clean and comfortable. The young man at the register was very helpful and friendly.

TouKA3Xox5upm9Sdg5lGoA.text: We just had dinner here tonight it was excellent. The food was amazing. We really enjoyed eating at a family-owned restaurant gives us a much different feeling than other restaurants. So cozy and inviting.

tL4BS9EQZxRhpCO-q63CFw.text: Such a gem of a cafe!! Definitely a must to visit for breakfast, lunch or even for some coffee and pastries!! The owner was very pleasant and very mush appreciated that we were there. All the food is homemade and very authentic!!    And the atmosphere is very quaint and beautiful such a relaxing restaurant!!   Definitely will be back.

d27wOyaZ0e0dSJGliyOBBQ.text: First time at this place. Very impressed. High quality food with great service. Will definitely come back .

qqKCeFNAEwcZeMxmvuBB5w.text: Very cute new local restaurant. Food is unique and has a European and Middle Eastern twist. Very good croissants here, better than most you can find in Phoenix. I recommend the rice pilaf for lunch, ot was fresh and tasty!

GgLdlp1eJtj0REox4BJddw.text: Excited to have this high quality bakery / cafe in Ahwatukee. The staff is exceptional. Knows what makes their products different than what you are going to find anywhere else in the area. Very clean and accommodating environment. They have a private tea room. I had a chocolate truffle and hazelnut & almond biscotti. Outstanding

8lSLbrvgZPh5LB2txGWc5Q.text: The best croissant I've eaten this side of Paris. Excellent blueberry muffin.  I'll be back for a dull breakfast. Try the cinnamon butter.  Good, local, family run joint.  Really nice peiple running the place.

jIEDvkmLK0IxtcBCn0cznQ.text: Went by Saturday night to check their dessert offerings. We indulged in their chocolate ganache like truffles each at $2 and took home their chocolate croissant and coconut macaroon. I didn't expect everything we bought to be excellent but it was! Everything is made fresh daily. Adam, the owner, was very personable. They also bake their own gluten free pita creation so I look forward to trying a pita gyros or other soon. Nice meeting room for birthday parties, Moms lunch etc. Recommended ! Currently open until 9 pm most nights too!

F8hcqKuluG4GcHHIfkxT7w.text: I heard this place opened and was on my list to try Ended up there today with a friend to check out Awesome!!! The nicest people that run it Very passionate about their work and product It is a business of love being put into there product They said if it's not the best you've ever had they would refund our money lol Spinach cheese puffs were melt in your mouth fantastic and flavorful  We sampled the tomorrow basil soup nice and light and flavorful but not bitter and over powerful, sweet Tried the chocolate cake which was amazingly light but the chocolate on the top was not hard but creamy melt in your mouth and not icing mmmmm Even coffee was specially selected and purchase local from family that has a coffee farm in Brazil Also has a private room available for parties lunches and high tea! Breakfast and lunch menus with great selections Open 6 am till 9 or 10 pm!

51vlTBlfEhh7MKMgJj2DGw.text: We has an early morning appointment that had us in this corner of the valley. Stopped in for breakfast and glad we did.  Nice, clean place. The food and service were spot on. Especially grateful that they have Turkish coffee. The Baked Egg Boat was delicious.  My wife I appreciated that they handled our special requests (no melon for her, no potatoes for me) with a smile and can do attitude.

RDXBsVRd4PShps3q5PC2nA.text: Talk about a hidden gem down near the Ahwatukee Foothills!  The Early baker offers a unique vibe from the relaxing lounge area to enjoy a coffee, to your traditional sit down tables and lastly the big tables that feel you are at home eating dinner with your family! The inside is warm and has cute branding of the rooster to align with the early baker aesthetic!  They offer breakfast all day, baked goods, delicious Mediterranean entrees and sandwiches. Plus if you are looking for traditional Turkish coffee, this is the place! Serving Illy Coffee and their lattes are light and more traditional lattes that you would expect in Europe.   My top favorite dishes were the french toast which was made with homemade bread and it seriously made all the difference. Not sickish sweet but the flavors were amazing! My next favorite was the lamb! You can get lamb here for $15.95! I am telling you, the flavors in the lamb were blended to perfection and reminded me of eating greek food back on the East coast with my family. The mixed grill platter had some amazing seasoned meat! If you love kebabs, this is the plate for you.   I cannot think of anything I did not like here. The cheesecake was out of this world. With the lightness of the cheescake and the lemon that cut the sweetness, it was soooo good! I will be back for more because the Early Baker blew it away with taste, hospitality and homie vibes.  Also they have a private event tea room for rental and offer gluten free options for their pies and some treats. So check them out, its my secret go to place in the foothills!

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mixed grill platter, the meat is soo good
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pesto turkey sandwich

gJAyoEim5tJGrWpSiKpvPg.text: Open on a Saturday at 8pm!!! Early baker opens at 6am and closes at 9pm every day!! The place is clean and the owner was running the bakery counter! He gave each of us a chocolate chip cookie that we all thought would be hard and crumbly but wasn't!!! I would go back for those cookies alone!! We got a 'sample' of most of the items. Each one was as good as the next! What a great local place! I recommend this place and will be back often!   Update :: website says 6-9pm daily That is not the case. So sad to see it closed by 830.  Been there a few times to find it not open when they say they are.  Time to update the website to reflect correct hours.

jDVFXl9K6VCzUDpeCwnQXA.text: I simply love Early Baker.  The macaroons, pastries, breakfast and the must try lamb chops.  The owner is always present and eager to please and greets you with a warm welcome.  I ordered my son's birthday cake and additional cookies to pick up today.  The cake went beyond my expectations and the cookies were just as stunning.  I highly suggest using the Early Baker for preorders as well as anything in between.

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special order
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bring your pup

mhytZWMrHJhp2sIM-VQwHg.text: Delicious! Don't let the name fool you! Early Baker has baked goods and a wonderful variety of breakfast, lunch and dinner dishes! Adam and his wife are a wonderful part of the community and the food is GREAT!

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States

o8W5EpHZgHf5yxKPJSVUeQ.text: Just had an amazing breakfast. I got the Early Steak and Eggs platter and it so good. Not crazy size portions, just right. Everything was well seasoned and very tasty. Service was great. You order at counter and they bring it to you. They have bakery items that all looked amazing. I have a food allergy and they were very accommodating. Loved the Turkish coffee! Definitely try this hidden gem.

XcMAxlFrjoCGKMrqXX5DEg.text: Great spot for any meal of the day! We salivated over the breakfast menu but went with lunch since it was noon. The chicken wrap was perfect! Moist flavorful chicken, garlic sauce and greens wrapped in a deliciously toasted wrap. I substituted the potatoes with a side salad which was perfectly dressed.   My friend loved the BBQ chicken panini and we got to taste 2 delicious soups. The only thing we didn't get to partake in were the delicious looking baked goods. That's because the servings are all very generous and we had no room for dessert. Next time we'll start with dessert or a croissant.

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch Menu

lfvR61L0vGDkJ7ZdBpnKrQ.text: The Early Baker is such a beautiful gem.  Their almond croissant is mind-blowing.  So buttery, light and flakey.  They have an extensive Mediterranean and American menu.  Their lamb chops are so fragrant and juicy.  That said their french toast on their in house homemade brioche bread is INCREDIBLE.  Owner's Kinani and Adam are wonderful.  If you need a bake baked, call the Early Baker!

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bPjxhEzfVl-IXGQTMUCd_g.text: All I have to say is, WOW ! First off I'd like to say that i was greeted very pleasantly as I entered which is a HUGE plus. I started off with the almond croissant which was honestly the best croissant I've ever had. The perfect amount of butteryness & perfect amount of crispy flakes it was phenomenal, & as the owner said, "the croissants are a must." Then the Brioche French toast came & I was blown away again. This is my new spot for sure. I can't wait to try more on the menu, but then again I loved what I ordered so I may have to order everything the same. Everybody should try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brioche French Toast with warm maple syrup &amp; fresh fruit

Q7eWPOA_RlneIEBoYdpHGQ.text: The owner, Adam, recommended the decadent Almond croissant and being a pastry connoisseur myself, this is by far the best one I've ever had! It was warm, crispy on the outside, and melted in your mouth. The almond paste in the middle was heaven. As a transplant from California, it's my favorite place to go for breakfast. Every time I come here the owner and his employees treat us like family. They are warm, kind & provide amazing service.

bHp85QkW6WGpCNcx2AzLUQ.text: Owner was pleasant, welcoming, generous and hilarious! Offered us the "private room" and provided me and my friends free samples of their homemade croissants which were buttery and delicious. Also the sample of the Turkish coffee was a nice touch...and will keep me up at night . The Nutella Banana crepe, the French toast, and the Quesadilla were yummy!  The lamb was good but I'd probably get a breakfast dish next time . The portion size of the the pesto pasta and turkey pesto panini was large. Pasta was creamy and panini was crunchy  Would definitely come back if I'm in the neighborhood.  Sorry no pics ... scarfed food down before I remembered.

vMW_E4YIKHwXECjSOrgZAA.text: The owners treated my Foster Care Mentee and I to a meal for her birthday. To be a child in foster care who will age out of it is hard but knowing that there are people out there who care about her made her birthday so much better. Thank you from the bottom my heart !!!!

Jn1-XnzmXcw4cZRCXfTWtA.text: The decor is warm and welcoming. You order at the counter, but don't let that deter you! The food is amazing! The coffees are so delicious. My iced latte was perfectly created with homemade vanilla. My daughter had a grey mocha, half while chocolate half dark chocolate. They offer soy or coconut milk alternatives for no additional charge! The portions are huge. The owners are incredibly hospitable. Such a great place to relax and enjoy breakfast! They asked if we had been there before. They did not charge us for our cake pop . The vegan baklava is fantastic! There are other vegan and vegetarian options too. All our meals (5 of us) were fresh and tasty. Food, drink and tip came to $85, about $17 per person. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Adorable decor

n2t02Q3w0ahY0wreEl-8wQ.text: What an amazing place to eat!!! The Croissants are the real deal the best I have ever had. The owner is amazing and so friendly! He ordered for me and it was perfect!  We tried the crepes (3 different types) and they were all just WOW! The breakfast burrito was huge and delicious! French toast was delicious!  The Turkish coffee will not disappoint! Thank you so much I will be back!

Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mixed berry crepes
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito

OkzZZPAx5ICcEToliSuZKg.text: If I could give 10 stars, I would. The turkey pesto panini was amazing! It was cooked to perfection. The owner is an amazing guy. I really dislike some places where the fountain drinks are watered down, but this place has the best fountain drinks I've had. Beyond refreshing and just the perfect amount of flavor/fizz. I'll definitely be returning ! I recommend this place to anyone looking for a quiet, new, and tasty place.

1COF0YiR7G9th2cICPkphw.text: First time visit today. What a waste of a great neighborhood bar! We were met by the owner with smart comments about extra fees for seating the patio because they have to walk further to deliver food. Then with limited to chicken or turkey products for our omellets, nothing on menu of choices of what could be in the omelette, veggies, cheeses etc.. OH and they advertise "free" coffee friday, the owner who I presume would know about coffee deal charged us full price for two coffees. I then said I had seen on their web site it was free coffee friday. He muttered something under his breathe like "you had to say that before we charge you"? Hey 2 plain cups of unamazing coffee for $5.00.   Next he informed us that if we didn't finish all our food we would have to go in the back and do his dishes. He really isn't funny, nor are his smart comments.   Saved the best for last! Our food came out, there is nothing on tables like jellies, salt pepper etc. When a server brought our food out he asked if we needed anything else, I asked for salt & pepper. The owner over heard my request and grabbed shakers and came to our table with both but said we didn't need salt because "his" food is cooked to perfection. The server was behind this guy rolling his eyes in disbelief. I asked him to leave the salt anyway. The server stayed at our table explaining the owner was just joking. I told him I did not appreciate being told now how I like my food, and that this was our first time visiting their restaurant and our last.   I still have a bad after taste from the pan potatoes, and the "turkey" bacon was so thin it was hard to find or see and really was tasteless. The only thing that added favor to our eggs were onions and peppers. Some kinda toast, toasted in a panini press, dry, cold, no butter or jelly, perhaps from a county jail recipe book. I made good use of it though with my "sad" left on plate for them to find (with salt shaker).   Leaving was uneventful with no thank you, no come again, no nothing. So thought I would spare some from this "overpriced" place. We were going to go to IHOP wish we would have.   Like I said "waste of a good neighborhood bar (fka Manhattan 's )

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sad face with dry bread served as dry toast.

cujyBAF5F28ubMpr_IIxtA.text: Tried this spot out today after a day of shopping. Granted it's a holiday ( Memorial Day ) so it was nice and quite. It was very cute inside.   I ordered a chicken platter; and it was very tasty. The potato's were great.   There is a large selections of sweets. I purchased some Cannoli's and they were very good in my opinion. I'd like to go for breakfast one day ( served all day ) because some if those options looked great.   It's a nice quaint spot with friendly staff and wholesome food.

_fU6zO4x38rUnJ-IsCglCQ.text: Great food, great service, great baked goods. Initially I was just looking for a local breakfast place that might be ok. I was amazingly surprised about how good it truly is.   Perfect eggs are hard to find but they're making amazing omelettes, great sunny side up's and awesome scrambled eggs here. The breads are always spectacular you won't find any pork bacon, but the turkey sausage and chicken sausage more than make up for it.  After trying breakfast I decided to check out their lunch and dinner menu and that was truly a revelation. The lamb chops are the best in town, the other meals are just as creative everything from a really well spiced burger to a ball of rice with ground beef in it. Both American and regional cuisine. Doing the cakes, pies, cookies, and other baked food justice just isn't possible without you trying. An incredible creative streak runs through the kitchen. Traditional cakes and cheesecakes, a Japanese style cheesecake perfect for summer (it is light and airy, a lemon meringue cheesecake that has to be seen and tried to be believed.  Apparently the coffee is really good too I don't drink coffee, but it is one of the only places in town where you can get a good Turkish coffee

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The ice cream cone on the ice cream cone cake was actually a giant cake pop
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. War of the melted ice cream cone cake
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Melted ice cream cone cake done to celebrate an achievement of work

HYur8YA20bZn9NhRE6raPg.text: Visited this place per my daughter's suggestion. This location was very attractive and inviting; well lit, clean with plenty of colors with a touch of rustic and contemporary.  As a west African native familiar with french cuisine, I was quite impressed with everything I had for breakfast.The food presentation was awesome especially the fresh fruits served on a bed of lettuce. The scrambled eggs were excellent;the sauteed baby potatoes with a hint of olive oil, garlic and some mysterious herbs were to die for.I am usually very hard to please when it comes to crepes but the Mixed Berry are worth the dive, it was succulent. To finish, you can't call it a breakfast without a good coffee...I had a double shot espresso with room for plentiful cream and it was delucious. Service was good but could be better. I felt that I was more interested about the restaurant and the food than they were about me...maybe their way to give customers some privacy... Nevertheless, I will definitely go back, maybe with the family next time.

HmgJSIMHsQtO6Jt594NF-A.text: Recently when our church, Desert Foothills United Methodist Church, was vandalized, they worked quickly with us to allow us to come and have our service at the restaurant. They catered amazing food and even gluten free! Many of our congregation had not been there before and really enjoy the experience!  As the pastor I hadn't really had time to eat. But before I left, the owner found out and made sure that I got to try some of the gluten-free crepes with lemon curd, fresh strawberries, and whipped cream. It was so delicious that I ate the whole thing on the way home. Lol!  It's a beautiful restaurant with lots of comfortable and convenient seeding. And a private room that would hold 20. A private party of about 100 would be perfect there.

z-B1S7096PcV_aH-3XZ2gw.text: Charming place with good customer service,  food was very good.  I would recommend this place for brunch or lunch.  I'm always looking for new restaurant to try.

fvFkMPQignVofNMhYoWUDQ.text: Delicious fresh food.  The owners are amazing. Another perfect meal today.  Went with a bunch of friends and everything was impeccable.  The special was so good. The gyro was perfect.  Their Greek salad is the best I've ever had.  Then the croissant bread pudding came out. One of the most delicious things I've ever eaten. I can't recommend this place enough and the owners are so kind and want you to leave happy. We did. All of my friends are coming back.

82IJVAFGoTLy61tByW9h9Q.text: The food here is not very good.  I ordered breakfast of 3 eggs over medium with toast, potatoes, and fruit.  The only thing tasty was the fruit.  The eggs were very runny and the potatoes were mushy.  The toast was ok but they don't give you any butter or jam.  My husband had a Greek salad which he said was just ok.  Not impressed.

fbU3PpHytgeOjRSVknMpdA.text: This is our favorite breakfast/bakery place! Perfect croissants, delicious pastries, awesome breakfasts - we've tried several (eg. egg boat, brioche French toast) and all have been great! Family owned and operated and the they treat everyone like friends.

eJnvqdoOKs7JLvzYtXGsMA.text: Was just introduced to the Early Baker. The owner is amazing and so dedicated to serving clean, real food without antibiotics or hormones. He was so welcoming and let us sample multiple pastries and the Japanese cheese cake. Everything was divine. I can't wait to go back for breakfast!

suU_6slG_bmfHDrUGHldLA.text: Great, family-owned restaurant. We came for brunch on a Sunday. They were very accommodating with our 6 month old, and let us order from the table rather than ordering at the counter. Delicious coffee! Amazing strawberry cheesecake! We will be back for sure.

fUN2GGTCRwnoAJ6HVFAVOQ.text: Our daughter brought us here while were visiting her.  My husband and I have been on a low carbohydrate diet but this eatery was definitely worth going off of it.  My daughter had the lemon cream and I had the egg boat.  We shared our brunches.  I have never had a food "moment" before this.  Two perfectly cooked and seasoned eggs over a spinach and cheese stuffed bread. absolutely fantastic.  The staff were helpful and friendly.  They had multiple types of seating which adds to the upbeat vibe.  This is a place that shouldn't be missed.

YL-EqeOB1HL1SV0BozwNSw.text: First time here, I came here for croissants and they were out of them! What kind of bakery is out of croissants by 9:00AM. So I got a breakfast sandwich instead and it was bland.

s0iK5WYk_x4zlMVTcmSanA.text: The service here is terrible.  I have gone in there several times and waited at the counter and nobody comes out to help you.  They actually have a bell that you have to ring for someone to come out.  There was one night that I went in to order food and the man came out that works there and told me that he wasn't going to be able to help me for about 15 or 20 minutes the restaurant was completely empty by the way.  There was no apology not explanation.  Another time I called in a to go order and the man who answered the phone asked me to text my order.  I don't believe this is great customer service.  Everytime I have gone in there the restaurant is empty so now I know.  I have never called a place for a to go order and was asked to text my order.  I finally stopped going there.  If i call or go into a business I expect to get helped right away and if not there should have been a reason why he couldn't help me for 15-20 minutes.  They also use bag salad I think which they charge way to much for.  Speaking of salad they serve it with eggs???? When I order breakfast I don't want salad with it.  I won't go here again the service is terrible and they act like they are doing you a favor or like you are bothering them.  This place will not last with that kind of attitude.

H0f30X3qRJvvIJXFXe0GGw.text: Came in for lunch, Gyro was great as were the salads. Owner was super nice and made our birthday visit really fun. The croissants were outstanding. Looking forward to coming back for breakfast.

Q0k42XBjW-0r49RlHwaBVQ.text: Meh. The food was good, but slow. Service and place were just a little strange.  I'll try it again, but it's generally unremarkable.

_KS_qiag7zS7Rbts-g1K9w.text: Great food, friendly staff!  Everything is made with love!  Owners are supportive to local needs!  Recently hosted our luncheon there for back to school shopping with a group of foster youth!  Thanks for your support!

QCkHfpxGGqoppBO5dOquYw.text: I love this place! The service here is phenomenal the food is a little piece of heaven. I had the "soup of the day" fresh tomato basil with toasted panini bread. Not to mention a calming, relaxing, festive environment. I was able to have brunch and complete all of my Christmas cards for family. I felt like I was sitting in the comfort of my own home.

YK-2g_3FRFGpzbVDOQew-Q.text: We have traveled far and wide in each of the cities we have visited to find the best bakeries. We recently moved to Phoenix  from the Bay Area and would frequent Tartine, waiting in long lines to buy their delectable baked goods. We now live in Ahwahtukee, and we have a neighborhood bakery that rivals Tartine!  No lines!  When the owner said their croissants were the best, I'm not going to lie. I was very skeptical.  The proof was in the tasting. The croissants are flaky and buttery, melting in the mouth. The almond croissant is a must buy! In addition to that flaky, buttery pastry, the frangipane is light and fluffy with a wonderful almond flavor. The spinach pastries were delicious as well, and the flavor the spinach was so yummy. We also had a cream puff, which was filled with a delicious, light cream. We plan on coming here often. The owners came out to greet us personally, making the whole experience wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cream puff in the background, butter croissant with their homemade apricot jam, two spinach pastries, and an almond croissant

5gvHLcOVGRhRP1ns4TeMzw.text: Good experience for our first visit. Came here 8am and sat on the beautiful patio with my dog child. Perfect place if you want a quiet relaxing morning with your pet and a cup of coffee. Very clean and a very friendly young man behind the counter. Only 4 stars because the price of our very basic egg sandwiches. 32$ for two plates and two coffees. I would recommend a pastry and coffee.

M2PC7pT0icGMrhLYwlBWBA.text: Great Greek styled restaurant. Uses illy Italian coffee.  Everything is good but the Tiramisu is fabulous! All the bakery items are made there. I had the very best Greek salad when in Greece several years ago. The one I had there comes very close. When I told the waiter they used onions instead of cucumbers, they made it up for me that way. The only thing lacking was unpasteurized fresh creamy feta cheese that they served in Athens. (Can't get this in the States).This is now my go to breakfast place when I am in the area.

LoQ7QLfZuQYCJG-nBBUNHA.text: First time here. Ordered breakfast to go. The crepes come with 2 per order. I couldn't decide between savory or sweet, so the owner suggested I get one of each/mix and match for the same price. At his suggestion, I got the smoked turkey and pesto crepe, and I also ordered the Nutella and banana crepe. Both were good, but wow I am glad I listened to his suggestion for the turkey and pesto crepe! It was amazing. I would like to come back to try the dinner specials because it looks really reasonably priced and hopefully tastes as good as the breakfast.

BmfiSk3fYzh5YBy9ef5ovQ.text: Food was really great! I had the Early Steak & Eggs and it was tasty! It came with a nice Mediterranean-style side salad that balanced the plate out perfectly. The patio was nice and clean and the ambiance was very relaxed.

PQQW0lRQsSWpQb0Nu9iAIw.text: Best blueberry muffin I ever have. The other pastries are amazing too. They have a private room for tea too!

5PhjX_CdgeGe6yBNkqI9yQ.text: We have visited Early Baker twice, it is awesome. The coffee is delicious and the croissants are the best ever. The chocolate or almond croissant are so flaky, crispy and delicious. You will not be disappointed if you visit.

kQ-EXDltfk_PVic0z0_2Tw.text: I wish I could give 10 stars! Best croissant I've ever had! The French Toast is amazing my daughter likes the egg sandwiches the homemade pastry's are absolutely delicious and the service is phenomenal I can't say enough about how friendly they are you feel like you're having a home cooked meal with friends

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan Burrito
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lemon Crepe
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkish Coffee

r28ttargOtBU0ew-gCIRCg.text: Over the past few years, I have come to enjoy and seek out the best in baked goods, regardless of where we are in the world. I'm used to waiting in long lines, and the whole experience feels quite impersonal.  However, at the Early Baker, on my first visit, the owners (and pastry chef) greeted us.  We had a butter croissant, almond croissant, spinach and cheese pastry, and a cream puff.  They were some of the best we've ever had, rivaling the best in San Francisco and NYC. We can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zWAiRQMbeG_5Z8ombXApXg.text: We had a great time. The owners are very nice. The coffee is great. I loved the vegan burrito. I definitely will come here again. They say if you call ahead of time they can make more vegan food. My friend loved the almond croissant.

urqWri7qTalnsrsaAtvyDw.text: What a gem in Ahwatukee!  It's been here for a while but just came in with my daughter today. Delicious fresh breakfast-bright, cheery, friendly atmosphere!  Definitely will be back. Oh and the latte...went for seconds!

OaeNH5eAZbn9G9jQfZCOHw.text: Nice ambience, great service, amazing food! Don't let the name fool you, this is way more than just a breakfast place. Loved their lamb chops! So glad this gem is in Ahwatukee.

vLyz7WRNTeASneUaxB7adw.text: Good stuff, I had the stake and eggs and it was fabulous .   I also like that they have a conference room that they let customers borrow for meetings.

3kngaivIVAtJ_VtPklFo5A.text: Had the earlybaker special this morning. It consisted of a spicy chicken sausage omelette with a side of salsa, fruit and brioche bread. The omelette was great -perfect amount of spiciness(jalepenos were not mentioned initially so they took me by surprise but nonetheless delicious). The fruit was bitter but the bread was so soft and amazing.

kdPOEZEZ7XMFyxh-AF1aZQ.text: Love fruit tart from this bakery! Always fresh and yummy! I wish the portion is little bit bigger but overall this place is a to go place for us for a coffee hangout with my friends!

D9TgUVw4e7OSvRDTEeZjzQ.text: I'm from a small town. This place had that feel. Great food and awesome people.  Coffee was amazing

h1s-h5Ya1MfFv4MSHmCXQw.text: Great pastries, I especially love the macaroons with chocolate.  I have also tried the croissants & lemon bars. Have been happy with every pastry.  Friendly service

CHdB5aV-03pKa14y7oYN_A.text: First time visiting, extremely impressive!! The espresso tastes super incredible. The owner adam recommended the French toast and it is probably the best I've had. My friend got the burrito and I will be getting that tomorrow morning! Will be returning and recommending to everyone! Thanks Adam for the treats and coffee!!

M2LL6EaQywwAZcSivraRZA.text: The customer service is the best you can ask for. Coffee and food is beyond delicious. Will be back very often.

77vD4pwa8idrS9Png-KNHA.text: Recently had Adam and his team cater an event for our first American title office here in Ahwatukee. Everybody loved the food,  Adam and his team are great to work with the prices are decent.  If you have a chance to go and actually have a dine in experience at this location I would highly recommend it either for breakfast or lunch.

ogDp0iWybcUSbIZ3Tqn2hw.text: It's really sad that people have to copy and paste people's Facebook photos and then create fake Yelp profiles to slam a quality restaurant that uses the best quality ingredients in their products.  What a phony, pusillanimous pipsqueek! Glad I caught this.  All the best wishes Adam and Kinana, the owners.    If this is reviewed by Yelp staff, please remove the other previous profile associated with my name.  THANK YOU YELP FOR REMOVING THE FAKE REVIEW!

hLrjGz1816sm7Y6dTiRxKw.text: First time here for breakfast. This resturant is brightly colored, very clean, and relaxing with booths, wood tables and grouping of comfortable chairs around a coffee table. There is also outside seating. At this  resturant you order at the counter where  behind the counter is brightly lit breakfast menu. The countet is filled with all sorts of tarts, baklava, macaroons and pastry.  Okay, if you know me, you know I love my coffee.  Well the coffee is really good.  Self sevice for water is found around the corner from the counter. So I got the egg boat.  OMG soft dough with different types of cheese on top melted while the dough is cooking and than two eggs are on top cooked perfectly.  It was wonderful. Doug got the Greek egg sandwich.  Both came with a Greek salad. We both really enjoyed our breakfast and plan to come back for lunch and dinner.

2cRWQA6wSLmWX-R_k3I9EQ.text: If eating a ham and cheese omelette is your thing this is not the place for you. They do not serve any pork products. They do however offer turkey products with their egg dishes. The pastries/cakes are to die for. They taste amazing. You also have to try their mango smoothie.  Adam the owner goes out of his way to remember your name and offer 5 star customer service. That's the way it should be. My wife and I will definitely be back.

7T6LMFtUyouANGLzjzBUrA.text: We came here to celebrate my fiancee's birthday, the owner and his wife were so nice. They brought out balloons, and a slice of cake for all of us to share. The food here is always delicious, the French toast was sooo good! Great service, great food!

3FEHs8cSJpvCrO5iZOVbMQ.text: I love their breakfasts!  The pastries are yummy, and the Japanese cheesecake is sooo wonderful.  The service is good, and the decor is cute.  The owners seem to be very nice people, and were very accommodating even last Thanksgiving when four of us went there for dinner.

UbfaoB03Je4QkGzGmvNLHw.text: Delicious fresh made food, nice family owned and operated restaurant. Very friendly! Can't wait to come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States

z-5-N1FvaQdbDB2SzO3VlQ.text: Apparently if you leave this place a review that is not a 5 star then it's fake or vindictive. But seriously for a small mediocre cup of coffee for $3.... this place is not getting a 5 star review. I didn't get to try their breakfast or other pasties aside from the croissant I got, which was just alright. Nothing to write home about. I feel like their prices are a bit high.

XURyaux5Z3tm0SgTKjIoCw.text: I just had a wonderful breakfast on my first visit. My Berry crepe was wonderful. The party room held 17 of us for my retirement party.

EM_so0xdE6I3onr_MCzwcw.text: Please support a local owner and family at the Early Baker their food is delicious, selections of breakfast lunch and dinner. My favorite is the French toast even for dinner! The bakery is delicious, people always warm and friendly, and is centrally located. They even have a nice meeting room you can reserve with a big table to enjoy with a group!

0t-mkwV5Md2tUGpXg0SS6g.text: Cute clean place. Breakfast all day. Had the turkey crepe and the Nutella crepe. Both are excellent. Also had the chocolate croissant and got two to go. The owner Adam adds to the experience he was friendly kind and humorous.

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rg8y1SSqmBab6j7HxhYHxA.text: I absolutely love the fine pastries here. Especially the macaroons! I have bragged to my fellow co workers, neighbors and friends about this wonderful place. The effort put into this place gives a  feel the warmth and authenticity !

XzUs9HhaQdFoYxibYAdaBw.text: One star, soley on how nice they redid the inside of this restautant and it's as low as I can go. Aside from that, this place is terrible and I was highly dissapointed. Not sure where to even start... We went in for breakfast, ordered some coffee and food. About 15 minutes went by before we had to ASK for our coffee. It was brought to us with no cream, sugar or spoon. Coffee was not hot and most definitely watered down. A very sad looking breakfast sandwhich followed, of course accompanied with no silverware, salt or pepper. The Early Greek sandwhich which was supposed to be a veggie frittata on fresh baked bread was served to us as plain scrambled eggs on dry white wonder bread, toasted like a panini. My spinach pie, which I had to ask about just like the coffee was going to be a few extra minutes as they were "cooking it fresh". I was under the impression they forgot about it, but whatever. It was served to me moments later, still frozen. My next concern... is this even a real bakery? Where are the free smells?! I think the Early Baker is a fraud.com This place has a lot of potential but needs a serious management intervention. Their location is great and Ahwatukee is thirsty for more breakfast spots. On a Saturday morning, this place should be packed! Instead, the employees were running around frazzled with only just a couple of tables. I gave it a go and can confidently say that there is no way I'll be giving this place a second chance. Good luck Early Baker. You can have the nicest looking restaurant around, but if your food and service sucks... chances are you won't be around for long.

ENUyPzG-eYp0bw7M-_P2zw.text: Don't do it. Seemingly charming place, but their menu isn't the best. Their "steak and eggs" is thinly sliced roast beef (lunch meat, seriously) with a side salad. Although we didn't know that the salad came with extra protein, a fly!! A whole, dead bug right on top.   They are very nice people and tried to make up for it with coupons, free desserts, etc but to be honest I was too grossed out to take part on their offer. Just don't do it, you will be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fly in salad
Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. FLY in the salad. Gross.

GD4We1bRrRAlR2XG2EbXWA.text: I ordered a gyro sandwich and blueberry muffin.  I was surprised by how great the food was -- it was very fresh and tasty.  I liked it so much I had a gyro craving and came back for another one a few days later.  As I write this my mouth is watering...I'll be headed back to EarlyBaker today.

-8cspBilV069bQAk-yX18g.text: Tried Early Baker twice, won't be back.  First time - take out from bakery;  my croissant was dry, possibly stale.  OK, that can happen, so I thought I would try to eat in.  Second visit was early afternoon on a Sunday.  Breakfast sounded good, so I tried an egg sandwich.  Got the cheese and egg - the bread was VERY good and they customized the order the way I wanted (no swiss).  It was big for an egg sandwich, but it wasn't flavorful.  The potatoes might have been ok, but they were served barely luke warm (some were even cold), they could have used some more seasoning and I thought the serving was stingy (seriously, it's potatoes, they aren't expensive).  The side fruit salad was also small and half frozen.  There was no salt & pepper on the table (maybe they keep it with the drinks, I didn't check) which might have helped flavor of both the potatoes and the sandwich.  Service was prompt and the server did check in on me.  I am sure there are other great places for breakfast in the area, so I won't try this place a third time.

l0iZ4r4kWGR1R2jOxW5UDg.text: Our new favorite place for breakfast, lunch and brunch! The owners are kind attentive and charming. The food is fabulous! The sweets are also to die for. Highly recommend.

vWSyxcdXE82_khVjxSFRZQ.text: We came in with high expectation due to high reviews on yelp but were sadly disappointed. The food is generally over priced for the value. We paid $3 for a tiny americano that was not refillable. We ordered their egg boat special and the bread underneath the eggs seemed to be prefabbed and resembling a pillsbury day-old croissant with a similar texture. Next, the chicken Florentine crepe was fairly tasty but overly creamy; the chicken and mushrooms were simply slapped on to a pile of crepe (the contents were not wrapped inside the crepes). Finally, we ordered an almond croissant which was good but not sure if it's worth the $5. While they did reheat the croissant for us, the croissant was lukewarm and still cold inside.

ZdUrmUPJaJPt42hQ1wBS_Q.text: One of the best Chocolate Croissants I have eaten! I also had a omelet which was very good as well. Owner was very nice and checked in to make sure we were happy with our meal. Winner for Ahwatukee.

BHk3FBx14ODnF-8qccCChg.text: Great staff. Very friendly and helpful.  Food was fabulous.we went for breakfast. The options were egg related but you had a large selection including crepes. There are also fresh bakery items for something light.

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Work an order station.

cTNmZhTOfwWgM1DFTES4dw.text: Bakery, burritos, coffee, breakfast - this place is amazing! Turkish coffee is very strong for anyone looking for something new+strong. Vegan burrito amazing. Lots of cookie options. Business owner is super sweet; staff is super sweet.

Azs9I-VK8umk9ZWzOHBt5Q.text: Meh is kind of how I feel about Early Baker. It's super cute inside, and the staff was nice. The coffee tasted watered down, the food was bland, the bread felt like something store bought versus freshly baked, and it took what felt like forever to come out once we ordered it. If we do go back, it may be to try the crepes. But that's an IF, for sure.

ZCM6J6DN38i-ChkbTsLRAA.text: We stopped in to Early Baker last Monday for the first time and have been back 3 more times since. We were enticed with their Lasagna, Linguini and Garlic Bread special for $7.99 and have returned for French Toast, Linguini with Baby Clams, a Ravioli and Shrimp dish, another Lasagna, Tiramisu, and Japanese Cheese Cake. Everything has been delicious and of the highest quality and the owners, Adam and Kinana, have treated us like family. They truly pour their heart and soul into their restaurant/bakery. My only regret is that I didn't stop in to this local gem sooner. Highly recommended!!

d81uvLXb4dS8YUsSN_WYkg.text: Such a beautiful restaurant, Crepes and Croissant are delicious! Nice and friendly staff.   This will be our new hang out place.

photos.caption: Photo of EarlyBaker - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Abo0aliPqjSwS02r-k5v6Q.text: Wow! Excellent food and Excellent people!  We were told by friends to try this place out while we were visiting Arizona. They said they had great coffee...THAT THEY DO! And homemade vanilla syrup to put in it (or drink...whatever you decide ;). The owners are fabulous! They make everything from scratch and OMG is it delicious. We had the eggs on a boat, brioche French toast, and a chocolate croissant....um YUM!   We quite possibly might go back for breakfast everyday while we are here!

iVsk-Ug8pKwlcPwY_P74Qg.text: We have been here a couple of times. Both times we had the soup which was delicious and seemed homemade. The Greek plate is delicious. Just enough food to constitute a reasonable serving and filling. The salad was fresh and the gyro meat which they said they made in house was delicious. We have tried some of the desserts as well and the cinnamon roll was delicious as was the Napoleon. The baklava had a delicious flavor with honey reminiscent of lavender.   The owners are very friendly and the ambience is nice with both indoor and outdoor eating areas. I think they might need to lower prices a bit or amp up the advertising because it hasn't been very busy when I've gone. I hope others in Tukee will come out to support local business because this place has a lot going for it.

QjqkxSRR2_RVVAcQK1Qg6Q.text: Exemplary customer service and my cappuccino was excellent, but everyone's breakfast was very bland. It's nothing a little seasoning, maybe a little salt and pepper, couldn't help but it needs something. We all had eggs, I had a frittata, and e everyone found their breakfast to be bland. The man at the counter was delightful and personable and made sure we had everything we needed. I hope they figure everything out and stay in business because it's a cute little place.

KD1d0myz6VZJZz22lp2Zrg.text: The food in this place is amazing. Talking with Adam the owner I find that they have only the best ingredients. They don't just make food they make spices rather than buying pre-ground stuff. For butter they use the Irish butter.  I got an egg boat and a croissant . It was all stunning. There is a lot of butter in the croissant and I don't know if they have one that might appeal a bit more to those watching their waistline. But if an occasional splurge on a Rich croissant is OK boy these are the best anywhere.
